contentList:
Aoskar Aoskar, also known as the Power of Portals and the Keeper of Gateways, was venerated as the god of portals within his own temple in the City of Doors. After a failed attempt to wrest control of Sigil from the Lady of Pain, the Lady slew Aoskar and cast out his corpse into the Astral Plane.

Domains: Arcana
Alignment: Neutral BLOOD AND BODILY FLUID LOG

Addendum the First: It is no longer necessary to log names. Species or creature type is sufficient. - MT

Addendum the Second: You will use either the term 'donor' or 'vessel' when describing a source of extraction. 'Victim' is an ugly and inaccurate word.

Name: [REDACTED]
Species: Half-Elf
Occupation: Farmer
Cause of Death: Extremity amputation
Extraction Fluid: Blood
Notes: Cadaver dumped in canal

Name: [REDACTED]
Species: Human
Occupation: Unknown
Cause of Death: Live extraction
Extraction Fluid: Blood, lymph, spinal fluid
Notes: Refused toll payment. Cadaver cremated after extraction.

Name: UNKNOWN
Species: Ogre
Occupation:
Cause of Death: Fatal wounds to skull and torso
Extraction fluid: Blood
Notes: Corpse confiscated by Balthazar

One of Blood Vendor Araj Obladra's elixirs, distilled from a specific sanguine quality, and with properties aligned to an equally specific species. A proud species that values clan and skills above all else. Once enslaved by dragons, they strive to be self-sufficient, not wanting to be beholden to anyone, not even the gods. You could just ask what species I am. Raised in one of Lolth's massive cults spread throughout the Underdark, these drow extol the virtues of their corrupt and merciless goddess, seeking to bring all other drow under her sway. Lolth marks her followers with vivid red eyes, in hope every species in Faerûn will learn to fear the very sight of them. An ancient dish, as old as the halfling species. Traditionally served with 'neeps' and 'tatties'. |I need the artefact that you carry. The whole fate of the our species depends on it.| The duergar - grey dwarves - were once enslaved by the eldritch mind flayer species, and adapted to freedom with a remarkably grim cruelty. Their stealth and viciousness makes them feared throughout the Underdark. Raised in one of Lolth's massive cults spread throughout the Underdark, these drow extol the virtues of their corrupt and merciless goddess, seeking to bring all other drow under her sway. Lolth marks her followers with vivid red eyes, in hope every species in Faerûn will learn to fear the very sight of them. The duergar - grey dwarves - were once enslaved by the eldritch mind flayer species, and adapted to freedom with grim cruelty. Their stealth and viciousness makes them feared throughout the Underdark. Generate a character with a random species, class, background, and appearance. *The monk-like githzerai, sibling lineage to your own githyanki. The only beings your people hate more are the illithids themselves.* *The monk-like githzerai, sibling-lineage to the warrior githyanki. Their contempt for one another is eclipsed only by their shared hatred of the illithids.* Example_Text_Block
